snippet: In a time when “mistakes were made” and no one can seem to name who made them or prosecute the known offenders, the rise of “the pivot” is inevitable.
abstract: Loose Ends column by Jesse Kornbluth, editor of HeadButler.com, observes that in an election year, particularly one with Mitt Romney, to 'pivot,' meaning to turn away from old, unworkable situations, is the new buzz word.
lead_paragraph: In a time when “mistakes were made” and no one can seem to name who made them or prosecute the known offenders, the rise of “the pivot” is inevitable.
